title: What's the science and mechanics behind video game disks? How can a video game developer project a virtual world through the disk? - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s nothing special about the disks. They’re just storage, nothing else. I’m not going to comprehensively explain how CDs and DVDs work. In short, the CD/DVD contains data. The CD/DVD reader reads the data from the disc. It could as easily be a hard disk or a thumb drive. The PC or game console reads the data from the disk and just uses it. It’s normally just a program that uses assets (art, sound) that are also stored as data on the disk. So the computer/console: Starts reading the diskFinds the programRuns itLoads any assets it’s told to loadUses them to “project a virtual world”That’s Game Execution 101. The disk isn’t special. It’s just a medium to store and deliver the game’s content.
